channel.title: JSON on Open Monster Vision
channel.description: Recent content in JSON on Open Monster Vision

item.title: Turning the D and D Monster Manual into JSON
item.description: The What I found a PDF copy of the monster manual (Of course I also own a copy, but I needed digital for this). I was able to grep out all the tables for monster stats…however, I couldn’t find a way to programatically get their names so I assigned them ID numbers. Git Repo GNU vs BSD Tools Though generally I script on my mac, I use the gnu tools vs the bsd tools.

item.title: How Not to Turn 10000 Json Files Into One Database, The Perils of Freelancing
item.description: The Wrong Way Worse Is Better As a grubby unix hacker, I usually take the easy way on my projects. And as of late, I have been getting fairly simple data conversion jobs from various freelancing sites and customers. So of course, worse is better is my go to philosophy. Well this dug ‘ol @bsdpunk into a little hole. I got a couple of example JSON files, from a guy who said he had a lot of data and wanted to turn them into a single CSV, to load into BigQuery.
